questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You are designing a machine learning solution.

You have the following requirements:

‚Ä¢ Use a training script to train a machine learning model.
‚Ä¢ Build a machine learning proof of concept without the use of code or script.

You need to select a development tool for each requirement.

Which development tool should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Use a training script to train a machine learning model --> Azure Machine Learning SDK for Python (Run configuration).

Build a machine learning proof of concept without the use of code or script. --> Designer.
Don't see how the top answer is correct if the say 'without the use of code' SDK uses code right?

comments.content: Only bottom answer says ‚Äòwithout use of code‚Äô

discussion.content:
Correct. 
To attach a Synapse Compute using Python SDK, first create an instance of azure.ai.ml.MLClient class. This provides convenient functions for interaction with Azure Machine Learning services. The following code sample uses azure.identity.DefaultAzureCredential for connecting to a workspace in resource group of a specified Azure subscription. In the following code sample, define the SynapseSparkCompute with the parameters:

 name - user-defined name of the new attached Synapse Spark pool.
 resource_id - resource ID of the Synapse Spark pool created earlier in the Azure Synapse Analytics workspace.

Answer is B. 
To invoke the constructor of the SynapseSparkCompute class in Azure Machine Learning SDK v2, you need to provide the resource ID of the Synapse Spark pool and a user-defined name.

questions.question_text:
You manage an Azure Machine Learning workspace named workspace1.

You must develop Python SDK v2 code to attach an Azure Synapse Spark pool as a compute target in workspace1. The code must invoke the constructor of the SynapseSparkCompute class.

You need to invoke the constructor.

What should you use?

choices.B: resource ID of the Synapse Spark pool and a user-defined name
choices.C: pool URL of the Synapse Spark pool and a system-assigned name
choices.D: Synapse workspace name and workspace web URL
choices.A: Synapse workspace web URL and Spark pool name

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
without using Tensorflow what else you can use?
I want to buy Microsoft 62-193 Exam questions with answers. Where can i buy should be the latest updated base

questions.question_text:
You plan to create a speech recognition deep learning model.
The model must support the latest version of Python.
You need to recommend a deep learning framework for speech recognition to include in the Data Science Virtual Machine (DSVM).
What should you recommend?

HOTSPOT
-

You manage an Azure Machine Learning workspace by using the Python SDK v2.

You must create a compute cluster in the workspace. The compute cluster must run workloads and property handle interruptions. You start by calculating the maximum amount of compute resources required by the workloads and size the cluster to match the calculations.

The cluster definition includes the following properties and values:
‚Ä¢ names=‚Äúmlcluster‚Äù
‚Ä¢ size=‚ÄúSTANDARD_DS3_v2‚Äù
‚Ä¢ min_instances=1
‚Ä¢ max_instances=4
‚Ä¢ tier=‚Äúdedicated‚Äú

The cost of the compute resources must be minimized when a workload is active or idle. Cluster property changes must not affect the maximum amount of compute resources available to the workloads run on the cluster.

You need to modify the cluster properties to minimize the cost of compute resources.

Which properties should you modify? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Correct.
Lower your compute cluster cost with low priority VMs.
from azure.ai.ml.entities import AmlCompute

cluster_low_pri = AmlCompute(
 name="low-pri-example",
 size="STANDARD_DS3_v2",
 min_instances=0,
 max_instances=2,
 idle_time_before_scale_down=120,
 tier="low_priority",
)
ml_client.begin_create_or_update(cluster_low_pri).result()

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You manage an Azure Machine Learning workspace. You create an experiment named experiment by using the Azure Machine Learning Python SDK v2 and MLflow.

You are reviewing the results of experiment by using the following code segment:

//IMG//


For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

//IMG//

comments.content: Aborted means cancelled by the user explicitly, not to be confused with "failed" jobs.

discussion.content:
Shouldn't be the first one YES. As runs[runs.status=="Failed"] will return aborted runs.
is it about the atributes.status?

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-track-experiments-mlflow?view=azureml-api-2#getting-params-and-metrics-from-a-run

comments.content: order by is ASC based on time so the 5 returned will be oldest not latest. So all will be NO
